brief:
Sets the specular color of the materials used for shapes drawn to the
 screen, which sets the color of hightlights.
name: specular()
description: Sets the specular color of the materials used for shapes drawn to the screen, which sets the color of hightlights. Specular refers to light which bounces off a surface in a perferred direction (rather than bouncing in all directions like a diffuse light). Used in combination with emissive(), ambient(), and shininess() in setting the material properties of shapes.

parameters.name: graphics
parameters.description: any object of the type PGraphics

parameters.name: gray
parameters.description: value between black and white, by default 0 to 255

parameters.name: v1
parameters.description: red or hue value (depending on current color mode)

parameters.name: v2
parameters.description: green or saturation value (depending on current color mode)

parameters.name: v3
parameters.description: blue or brightness value (depending on current color mode)
